briefdescription.para: Successful status code returned by ADC_control().

detaileddescription.para: ADC_control() returns ADC_STATUS_SUCCESS if the control code was executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Generic error status code returned by ADC_control().

detaileddescription.para: ADC_control() returns ADC_STATUS_ERROR if the control code was not executed successfully.

briefdescription.para: An error status code returned by ADC_control() for undefined command codes.

detaileddescription.para: ADC_control() returns ADC_STATUS_UNDEFINEDCMD if the control code is not recognized by the driver implementation.
Common ADC_control command code reservation offset. ADC driver implementations should offset command codes with ADC_CMD_RESERVED growing positively
Common ADC_control status code reservation offset. ADC driver implementations should offset status codes with ADC_STATUS_RESERVED growing negatively.

briefdescription.para: A handle that is returned from an ADC_open() call.
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_close().

memberdef.definition: typedef int_fast16_t(* ADC_ControlFxn) (ADC_Handle handle, uint_fast16_t cmd, void *arg)
memberdef.name: ADC_ControlFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_control().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_ConvertFxn().

memberdef.name: ADC_ConvertToMicroVoltsFxn

briefdescription.para: A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_convertToMicroVolts().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_init().
A function pointer to a driver specific implementation of ADC_open().
Function to close an ADC driver instance.

simplesect.para: ADC_open() has to be called first.

briefdescription.para: Function performs implementation specific features on a driver instance.

simplesect.para: ADC_open() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: A command value defined by the device specific implementation
An optional R/W (read/write) argument that is accompanied with cmd

simplesect.para: Implementation specific return codes. Negative values indicate unsuccessful operations.

parameterdescription.para: The cmd value is not supported by the device specific implementation.

briefdescription.para: Function to perform an ADC conversion.

detaileddescription.para: Function to perform a single channel sample conversion.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a uint16_t to store the conversion result
The conversion failed and value is invalid.

briefdescription.para: Function to convert a raw ADC sample into microvolts.

simplesect.para: ADC_convert() has to be called first.

parameterdescription.para: A sampling result return from ADC_convert()

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the ADC driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function must also be called before any other ADC driver APIs.

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the ADC peripheral.

detaileddescription.para: Function to initialize the ADC peripheral specified by the particular index value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an initialized ADC_Params structure. If NULL, the default ADC_Params values are used.

simplesect.para: An ADC_Handle on success or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Initialize an ADC_Params structure to its default values.

detaileddescription.para:
params
A pointer to an ADC_Params structure.
Default values are:
ADC_Params.custom = NULL
ADC_Params.isProtected = true

briefdescription.para: Analog to Digital Conversion (ADC) Input Driver.

detaileddescription.para: The ADC driver allows you to manage an Analog to Digital peripheral via simple and portable APIs. This driver supports sampling and converting raw values into microvolts.
This documentation provides a basic usage summary and a set of examples in the form of commented code fragments. Detailed descriptions of the APIs are provided in subsequent sections.
An ADC conversion with an ADC peripheral is started by calling ADC_convert(). The result value is returned by ADC_convert() once the conversion is finished.
Refer to the Driver's Configuration section for driver configuration information.
